com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class SmartCommands

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands

  • public final class SmartCommands
extends java.lang.Object
    A container which encloses various types which enable to run commands in a detached thread.
    Since:
    2011.11.03
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SmartCommands.AbstractSimpleGuardedCommand<ContextClass extends android.content.Context>
      A handy SmartCommands.GuardedCommand which will issue systematically a log when an exception occurs during the command execution, and will trigger a SmartCommands.GuardedException which wraps the original exception in that case.
      static class  SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand
      A handy SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand which will issue systematically dismiss a Dialog once the command execution is over.
      static class  SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<ContextClass extends android.content.Context>
      A Runnable used as command, which is allowed to throw an exception during its execution.
      static class  SmartCommands.GuardedDialogInterfaceClickListener
      A DialogInterface.OnClickListener which runs its execution in the low-priority threads pool, and which handles exceptions.
      static class  SmartCommands.GuardedException
      An exception which acts as an Throwable wrapper, and which works in combination with the SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand.
      static interface  SmartCommands.GuardedHandler
      Defines a single contract which enables to turn an exception into another one.
      static class  SmartCommands.GuardedViewClickListener
      A View.OnClickListener which runs its execution in the low-priority threads pool, and which handles exceptions.
      static class  SmartCommands.ProgressGuardedCommand
      Enables to execute in background a task, by notifying when the execution is running.
      static class  SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand
      A handy SmartCommands.AbstractSimpleGuardedCommand dedicated to activities.
      static class  SmartCommands.SmartThreadPoolExecutor
      Introduced so as to be able to catch the exceptions thrown in the framework thread pools.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SmartCommands.SmartThreadPoolExecutor LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL
      Use this threads pool instead of creating your own Thread.MIN_PRIORITY threads.
      static int LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL_DEFAULT_SIZE
      Indicates how many threads at most will be available in the low-priority threads pool, by default.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void execute(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Equivalent to invoking SmartCommands#LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL#execute(Runnable).
      static void execute(SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<?> guardedCommand)
      Simply executes the provided command via the LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL, which enables to run a command, and take benefit from the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler if the command triggers an exception.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL_DEFAULT_SIZE

        public static final int LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL_DEFAULT_SIZE
        Indicates how many threads at most will be available in the low-priority threads pool, by default. It needs to be sent at the application start-up.

        You may change that pool size by invoking the ThreadPoolExecutor.setCorePoolSize(int) method.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL

        public static final SmartCommands.SmartThreadPoolExecutor LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL
        Use this threads pool instead of creating your own Thread.MIN_PRIORITY threads.
        • This pool will contain at most LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL_DEFAULT_SIZE threads by default;
        • exceptions thrown by the Runnable are handled by the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler.

        You can use this pool in the application, instead of creating new threads.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public static void execute(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Equivalent to invoking SmartCommands#LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL#execute(Runnable).
        See Also:
        execute(SmartCommands.GuardedCommand)

      • execute

        public static void execute(SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<?> guardedCommand)
        Simply executes the provided command via the LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL, which enables to run a command, and take benefit from the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler if the command triggers an exception.

        Equivalent to invoking SmartCommands#LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL#execute(SmartCommands.GuardedCommand).

        Parameters:
        guardedCommand - the command to be executed
        See Also:
        #execute(Activity, Runnable)
